rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;6b902595.1502">   <title>CfP - Rethinking Hegemony and Domination in Translation - slight revision </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;6b902595.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>Please find below another reminder for a special issue in the journal 'Target'. Please note that the submission deadline of completed papers has been moved forward to 31 December 2015.<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br><br>Rethinking Hegemony and Domination in Translation<br><br>Special Issue of Target \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd International Journal of Translation Studies<br><br>Guest edited by Stefan Baumgarten and Yan Ying (Bangor University, Wales, UK),<br>and Jordi Cornell\ufffd\ufffd-Detrell (Glasgow University) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-15T17:06:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stefan Baumgarten</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;6b902595.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;1136e411.1502">   <title>Visiting Fellowship in Edinburgh </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;1136e411.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Please see the link below if you are interested in applying for a 2 month visiting fellowship in Edinburgh University to conduct research on environmental humanities. You need a PhD and there is some financial support.<br><br>http://www.iash.ed.ac.uk/fellowships/fellowships-at-iash/environmental-humanities-vrf/<br><br>best wishes,<br><br>Arran<br><br>----<br><br>Arran Stibbe<br>Reader in Ecological Linguistics<br>National Teaching Fellow<br><br>School of Humanities<br>University of Gloucestershire<br>FCH Campus, Swindon Road<br>Cheltenham GL50 4AZ [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T10:48:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>STIBBE, Arran (Dr)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;1136e411.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;1d7fafa5.1501">   <title>New Version of Ecolinguistics bibliography </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;1d7fafa5.1501</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>Dr Stibbe and I have updated a new version of Ecolinguistics bibliography, you can find Word and EndNote version of bibliography at<br>www.ecoling.net/bibliography<br><br>If you spot any errors or have any entries to add then please get in touch with me (bibliography@ecoling.net).<br>If anyone wants to edit this bibliography to create a specialist one (e.g., a bibliography for Language Ecology, a bibliography of articles in Spanish, or an annotated bibliography) then please do get in touch. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T15:37:41+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mahnaz Talebi</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;1d7fafa5.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;14637813.1501">   <title>Anders Hansen and David Machin publish Visual Environmental Communication </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;14637813.1501</link>   <description> Anders Hansen (University of Leicester) and David Machin (University of Orebro) are pleased to announce the publication of Visual Environmental Communication&lt;http://www.routledge.com/books/details/9781138803756/&gt; (Routledge, 2015)<br>Contents:<br><br>1. Introduction: Researching Visual Environmental Communication. Anders Hansen &amp; David Machin<br><br>2. Visualizing the Chesapeake Bay Watershed Debate. Elizabeth Anne Gervais Schwarz<br><br>3. Imaging Toxins. Jennifer Peeples<br><br>4. Selling Nature in a Resource-Based Economy: Romantic/Extractive Gazes and Alberta's Bituminous Sands. Geo Takach [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-13T16:05:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hansen, Anders S.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;14637813.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;24b82b8b.1412">   <title>Request </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;24b82b8b.1412</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Sorry to bother you again. I am still working on my MA in which i am<br>examining the language used in conservation discourse in Mulanje Mountain<br>Forest Reserve (MMFR) to see whether it fosters/hinders citizen<br>participation and dialogue. I am using Halliday's SFL as a theoretical<br>framework. Sometime back, Dr. Stibbe advised me to include an aspect of<br>erasure which i did. Right now I am doing data analysis but I am finding it<br>hard because i can't come across any literature/articles that are using SFL<br>(including Grammatical Metaphor) to analyse environmental conservation<br>discourse, and also articles on [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-28T14:25:08+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>peter jiyajiya</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;24b82b8b.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;4201f407.1412">   <title>Re: Religion and ecology list </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;4201f407.1412</link>   <description> Dear Joshua Nash (and all the others!),<br>Thank you for the information and for the kind offer. I decided to<br>answer this post of yours because I really miss doing ecolinguistics.<br>And because I tend to agree with you on the meaning of 'real'<br>ecolinguistics, in fact. Maybe like you, I've also learned this meaning<br>from those that have started the field in Austria, Australia, Germany,<br>Danemark, etc.<br>In case you happen to come to Portugal, let me know in advance, so that<br>our garden looks a little nicier and tastier than right now. In fact,<br>I'm not having much [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T00:46:20+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adelaide Chichorro Ferreira</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;4201f407.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;691d7e29.1412">   <title>Framespotting and the finite planet </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;691d7e29.1412</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>I received an email from Alison Matthews, author of a promising new book Framespotting: Changing how you look at things changes how you see them. She has allowed me to forward the email on to you (see below). I think the framing approach has great possibilities for ecolinguistics since it\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds frequently used in practical projects which really aim to make a difference, like the Finding Frames project (see http://findingframes.org/report.htm ). George Lakoff\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds paper Why it matters how we frame the environment is a useful introduction, and I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve attached it. Sometimes the terms frames and framing are used in [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-09T22:13:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>STIBBE, Arran (Dr)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;691d7e29.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;aced2396.1412">   <title>Re: Religion and ecology list </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;aced2396.1412</link>   <description> http://www.religionandnature.com/society/<br>Another group doing similar stuff, worth joining and interacting with.<br>cheersTodd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdwe are receptive, imaginative beings, adapted to celebrate and rejoice in the existence, quite independent of ourselves, of the other beings on this planet.&quot;--Mary Midgley<br><br>&quot;We are creating a less stable and interesting place for our descendants to inherit. They will understand and love life more than we, and they will not be inclined to honor our memory.&quot; ---E.O. Wilson [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-05T13:12:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Todd LeVasseur</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;aced2396.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;e9d9af05.1412">   <title>Religion and ecology list </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;e9d9af05.1412</link>   <description> Dear Ecolinguistics List,<br><br>There is an email list dedicated to religion and ecology which might be of (some) interest to (some) ecolinguists. Details can be found at:<br><br>http://fore.research.yale.edu/<br><br>For those I know, and those I don't, and those who could(n't) care less, I am now based as a post-doctoral fellow at the University of New England in Armidale, New South Wales, Australia for the next three years. If anyone on this list is passing through this part of Australia, please look me up and come and stay with us and do some 'real' ecolinguistics (i.e. eating from our garden). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-05T11:06:29+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Joshua Nash</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;e9d9af05.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;f6e1a079.1412">   <title>Call for Papers - Rethinking Hegemony and Domination in Translation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;f6e1a079.1412</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>Please see the attached Call for Papers. We would be grateful if you could distribute it as widely as possible.<br><br>Many thanks and best wishes!<br><br>Stefan Baumgarten   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-03T14:21:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stefan Baumgarten</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;f6e1a079.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;a561ee74.1411">   <title>Re: New article based on the Forum Survey that was administered in 2013 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;a561ee74.1411</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>I just wanted to express my thanks and appreciation to Todd for this article. It\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds an extremely useful analysis of the data that resulted from the Ecolinguistics Survey we conducted last year, as well as some valuable suggestions and comments about the discipline of ecolinguistics now and in the future. I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve attached the full data from the survey so you can see all the answers given by respondents. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-10T15:40:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>STIBBE, Arran (Dr)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;a561ee74.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;44f0bfe1.1411">   <title>New article based on the Forum Survey that was administered in 2013 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;44f0bfe1.1411</link>   <description> Greetings everyone!\ufffd\ufffd I'm attaching an article that is currently available online, and soon to be published as an article in the Journal of Environmental Studies and Sciences, that is my summary of the survey from the end of 2012/early 2013 that Arran had administered.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>Here's the abstract:<br>Ecolinguistics is an emerging field ofstudy within the social sciences, with implications for all domains ofknowledge production.\ufffd\ufffd From its initialemergence within the field of linguistics in the early 1990s, it has meantdifferent things to different scholars, so to date lacks a coherentself-definition.\ufffd\ufffd Some scholars interpretecolinguistics to mean the iterative interaction between human discourses [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-10T14:52:20+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Todd LeVasseur</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;44f0bfe1.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;96d0926a.1410">   <title>NEW article just posted </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;96d0926a.1410</link>   <description> Hello, Language and Ecology Forum members -<br><br>It is my pleasure to announce the newest addition to the Language and Ecology online journal archive. Richard J. Alexander, emeritus professor of Vienna University of Economics, has shared with us: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdHow BP dealth with the aftermath of the 2010 Gulf of Mexico Deep Water Horizon Spill: Crisis communication under the microscope.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd A pdf of the article can be found in the Environment and nature section of Articles on www.ecoling.net [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-19T16:18:11-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Amy Free</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;96d0926a.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;5ef2baff.1410">   <title>New book series on Media and Environmental Communication </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;5ef2baff.1410</link>   <description> Anders Hansen and Stephen Depoe are pleased to announce the launch of a new book series, Palgrave Studies in Media and Environmental Communication.<br>[cid:image001.jpg@01CFE9FE.3EEB3280]<br>Drawing on both leading and emerging scholars of environmental communication, the series features books on the key roles of media and communication processes in relation to a broad range of global as well as national/local environmental issues, crises and disasters. Characteristic of the cross-disciplinary nature of environmental communication, the books showcase a broad variety of theories, methods and perspectives for the study of media and communication processes regarding the environment. Common to these is the endeavour [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-17T10:40:46+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hansen, Anders S.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;5ef2baff.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;7827d1f5.1409">   <title>book announcement </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;7827d1f5.1409</link>   <description> Voice and Environmental Communication, Jennifer Peeples and Stephen Depoe, Eds. Published as part of the Palgrave Series in Media and Environmental Communication.<br>Voice and Environmental Communication explores how people give voice to, and listen to the voices of, the environment. The collection includes nine original essays organized into three sections: Voice and Environmental Advocacy, Voice and Consumption, and Listening to Non-human Voices. Four notable scholars reflect on these chapters, and provide both an audience to the scholars as well as a forum for extending their own understanding of voice and the environment. This foundational book introduces the relationship between these [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-26T22:14:14+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jennifer Peeples</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;7827d1f5.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;d41ac04.1409">   <title>II Brazilian meeting on Ecolinguistics </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;d41ac04.1409</link>   <description> Dear all, here in Brazil we have a meeting on Ecolinguistics which is called 'EBE - Encontro Brasileiro de Ecolingu\ufffd\ufffdstica' (Brazilian Meeting on Ecolinguistics). The first one happened University of Bras\ufffd\ufffdlia, in 2012, and the works were published on 'Cadernos de Linguagem e Sociedade - Papers on Language and Society' that can be acessed here: http://periodicos.unb.br/index.php/les/issue/view/833. The second one will take place at University of Goi\ufffd\ufffds, in Goi\ufffd\ufffdnia, on November, this year. Here is the website: http://nelim.letras.ufg.br/pages/49350-ii-ebe-ii-encontro-brasileiro-de-ecolinguistica. Soon, the submissions will be open.<br>Contributions are welcome in Portuguese, Spanish or English. Everyone is invited. Best, Prof. Davi B. Albuquerque.    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-06T15:19:41-03:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Davi Albuquerque</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;d41ac04.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;30eb51b1.1409">   <title>Speciests representations in Buenos Aires </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;30eb51b1.1409</link>   <description> Hi everybody!<br><br>On September 18 I'll be talking about speciests representations in<br>argentine legislation in the Coloquio Internacional &quot;Violencia en<br>Am\ufffd\ufffdrica Latina&quot; at the Biblioteca Nacional Mariano Moreno (Aguero 2502,<br>Buenos Aires, Argentina). I'll present my paper _Violencia animal: el<br>decreto 1088/2011, tenencia responsable y permiso para vivir. Las normas<br>de protecci\ufffd\ufffdn animal y el discurso especista._ The paper is in spanish<br>but I'm already working on an english version. If anyone is interested<br>the spanish version can be downloaded<br>here:https://www.academia.edu/attachments/34637578/download_file?s=work_strip [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-05T17:36:22-03:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Diego Forte</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;30eb51b1.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;bc15a2a7.1409">   <title>Ecolinguistics Bibliography </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;bc15a2a7.1409</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Our bibliography editor, Mahnaz, and I have been working on building a more up-to-date ecolinguistics bibliography. You can find our first attempt at www.ecoling.net/bibliography&lt;http://www.ecoling.net/bibliography&gt;, version A. What\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds new is that the bibliography is in both Endnote form and Word form.<br><br>If you haven\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt used Endnote before you\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdll find it\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds a useful way to manage the references when writing journal articles and books. And even better, there\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds a similar open-source program that\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds free and just as good called Zotero (https://www.zotero.org). If you\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre using Endnote or Zotero then you can download the Endnote version of the bibliography and then use [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-02T18:32:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>STIBBE, Arran (Dr)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;bc15a2a7.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;7bd01e32.1408">   <title>Ecolinguistics on Facebook and Google+ </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;7bd01e32.1408</link>   <description> Language and Ecology Research Forum<br><br>Dear all,<br><br>The Forum\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds bibliography editor, Mahnaz Talebi, has set up ecolinguistics groups on facebook and google+. You can find them here:<br><br>https://www.facebook.com/groups/1521818114717705/<br><br>Ecolinguistics Group - Community - Google+&lt;https://plus.google.com/u/1/communities/110390554073816285549&gt;<br><br>The aim in the future is to use these groups for interactive discussions, for example discussing books with their authors. If you use facebook or google+ and want to get involved in online discussions about ecolinguistics then please have a look. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-26T17:18:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>STIBBE, Arran (Dr)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;7bd01e32.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;941ee397.1408">   <title>New Team </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;941ee397.1408</link>   <description> Dear members of the Language and Ecology Research Forum,<br><br>I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm pleased to announce the new team who will be convening the Forum. We are:<br><br>Convenor \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Arran Stibbe (me!) convenor@ecoling.net&lt;mailto:convenor@ecoling.net&gt; or astibbe@glos.ac.uk&lt;mailto:astibbe@glos.ac.uk&gt;<br><br>Articles editor - Amy Free. Amy is currently a graduate student of Anthrozoology at Canisius College. She has worked professionally as an interpreter at the University of Wisconsin since 2001, in addition to writing, editing, and interpreting work done through her private practice. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-23T10:20:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>STIBBE, Arran (Dr)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;941ee397.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;a495ee5b.1408">   <title>language and environment </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;a495ee5b.1408</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>I am quite new to this list, but I wanted to let you know that I am working on an application that focuses on the role of language and environment (see attached project application).<br><br>The attached paper refers to a new AHRC funding scheme:<br>http://www.ahrc.ac.uk/Funding-Opportunities/Pages/Open-World-Research-Initiative.aspx<br><br>This funding schemes aims to promote projects that work with non-English languages (modern languages). I have formed an interdisciplinary research group at the University of Leicester and have established some contacts with universities overseas. However, I am looking for partnerships in the UK. The call is open to all disciplines, but, as I [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-19T08:11:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Morgner, Christian (Dr.)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;a495ee5b.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;3804469f.1408">   <title>new editors </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;3804469f.1408</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Thanks for those who have been in touch about the roles of book review editor and bibliography editors. I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm pleased to say some great people have come forward to take them on. I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdll be introducing them shortly.<br><br>best wishes,<br><br>Arran<br><br>----<br><br>Arran Stibbe<br>Reader in Ecological Linguistics<br>National Teaching Fellow<br><br>Department of Humanities<br>University of Gloucestershire<br>FCH Campus, Swindon Road<br>Cheltenham GL50 4AZ [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-19T07:49:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>STIBBE, Arran (Dr)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;3804469f.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;a5c80ba8.1408">   <title>Ecolinguistic Activism through Acoustic Ecology, Countermapping, Travel Wreading, and Conversations with Landscapes </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;a5c80ba8.1408</link>   <description> Hello!<br><br>I recently completed a thesis entitled *A\ufffd\ufffd J\ufffd\ufffdkla: Ecolinguistic Activism<br>through Acoustic Ecology, Countermapping, Travel Wreading, and<br>Conversations with Landscapes*. Though I've marked the thesis as closed to<br>the public for now, if anyone on the ecolinguistics listserv would like to<br>access it, I would be happy to arrange that for you. An abstract is below. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-18T14:31:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>a rawlings</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;a5c80ba8.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;e7ba8f1f.1408">   <title>Ecolinguistics and animals </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;e7ba8f1f.1408</link>   <description> Dear Arran, and hello to all eco-ling members<br><br>I know some members are working on animals and their representation, so there might be some interest in this recent paper.<br><br>with very best wishes<br><br>Alison<br><br>Dr Alison Moore<br>Lecturer, English Language &amp; Linguistics<br>Faculty of Law, Humanities and the Arts<br>University of Wollongong NSW 2522<br>Room 19.2096<br><br>T + 612 4221 4949<br>W www.uow.edu.au/arts/language/ELL&lt;http://www.uow.edu.au/arts/language/ELL&gt; [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-19T10:24:29+10:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alison Moore</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;e7ba8f1f.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;b8763591.1408">   <title>and there's more... </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;b8763591.1408</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>The Language and Ecology Research Forum is looking for a new bibliography editor and a new book review editor. These voluntary posts don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt take much time and do make a valuable contribution to ecolinguistics \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd many thanks to our previous editors for their work. Here\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds more information:<br><br>Bibliography editor: This role will involve making an electronic bibliography using Endnote or Zotero (a free and easy bibliographic software package). It\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds quite a big task but made easier because there\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds already an existing bibliography in Microsoft Word form, and a couple of hundred items are already in Endnote/Zotero format. It\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-18T13:20:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>STIBBE, Arran (Dr)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;b8763591.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;250910b0.1408">   <title>Language and Ecology Research Forum </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;250910b0.1408</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve just updated the Language and Ecology Research Forum website \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd it\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds higher quality now and can be viewed on iPads and mobile phones (hopefully!). You can see it at www.ecoling.net&lt;http://www.ecoling.net&gt;, - please let me know if notice any errors. And if you can recommend any \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdKey ecolinguistics books\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd for the bibliography section then please email me (they need to be relevant to ecolinguistics, general enough to be useful for a range of researchers, accessibly written so we don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt put off anyone coming to ecolinguistics for the first time, and can be in any language). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-18T13:10:25+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>STIBBE, Arran (Dr)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECOLINGUISTICS;250910b0.1408</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
